title: Famous Speeches
description: Match famous quotes and speeches to their speakers — how well do you know history's greatest orators?

questions.question: Who said 'I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin'?
questions.explanation: Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his iconic 'I Have a Dream' speech at the March on Washington on August 28, 1963.

questions.question: Who declared 'The only thing we have to fear is fear itself'?
questions.explanation: FDR spoke these words during his first inaugural address on March 4, 1933, during the depths of the Great Depression.

questions.question: Who said 'Ask not what your country can do for you — ask what you can do for your country'?
questions.explanation: JFK delivered this famous line during his inaugural address on January 20, 1961.

questions.question: Who said 'We shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds... we shall never surrender'?
questions.explanation: Winston Churchill delivered this defiant speech to Parliament on June 4, 1940, after the evacuation of Dunkirk.

questions.question: Who proclaimed 'That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind'?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong spoke these words as he became the first person to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969.

questions.question: Who said 'Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!'?
questions.explanation: Ronald Reagan made this demand at the Berlin Wall on June 12, 1987. The wall came down two years later in 1989.

questions.question: Who said 'Give me liberty, or give me death!'?
questions.explanation: Patrick Henry delivered this impassioned plea for American independence in 1775, helping convince Virginia to join the Revolution.

questions.question: Who said 'I came, I saw, I conquered' (Veni, vidi, vici)?
questions.explanation: Julius Caesar reportedly said this in 47 BC after a quick victory at the Battle of Zela.

questions.question: Who said 'Ich bin ein Berliner' (I am a Berliner)?
questions.explanation: JFK declared solidarity with West Berlin in this 1963 speech, delivered in German to a crowd of 450,000.

questions.question: Who delivered the Gettysburg Address beginning 'Four score and seven years ago'?
questions.explanation: Abraham Lincoln delivered the brief but powerful Gettysburg Address on November 19, 1863, during the Civil War.

questions.question: Who said 'The ballot is stronger than the bullet'?
questions.explanation: Abraham Lincoln made this statement emphasizing the power of democratic voting over violence.

questions.question: Who said 'Be the change that you wish to see in the world'?
questions.explanation: This quote is widely attributed to Mahatma Gandhi, the leader of India's nonviolent independence movement.

questions.question: Who said 'We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal'?
questions.explanation: Thomas Jefferson wrote these words in the Declaration of Independence, adopted on July 4, 1776.

questions.question: Who said 'That which does not kill us makes us stronger'?
questions.explanation: Friedrich Nietzsche wrote this famous aphorism in 'Twilight of the Idols' in 1888.

questions.question: Who said 'A woman is like a tea bag — you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water'?
questions.explanation: This quote is attributed to Eleanor Roosevelt, who served as First Lady and later as a UN delegate and human rights champion.
